page.title: 08Stone Church
page.content: There is no record of Stone Church in the Domesday Book,but it is thought to have a{Norman foundation -1150 A.D. A new church was built in 1831, and it was enlarged in 1899. Money for these projects came from Stone Parochial Charity which dates back tothe late 15 century.The{Chantry Chapel}and the {School House}were built at about the same time,with later alterations and additions. The main Sunday Service at 11a.m. is by rotation,a Family Service ,a Prayer Book Communion,and ASB Rite B Communion.There is an evening service once a month.Sunday School meets at 11a.m.in the Parish Room. The church, for centuries serving hamlets with a population of no more than 800,is now the parish church of an area of nearly 5000 people,with the new housing estate at Spennells.
